question: Which one is the first Indian firm to cross market capitalization of ₹10 lakh crore?
explanation: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) became the first Indian firm to cross the market capitalisation of ₹10 lakh crore as its shares touched its new 52-week high of ₹1,581.25 on November 28 morning, valuing RIL at over ₹10,03,206 crore, India’s most valued. This makes RIL chairman Mukesh Ambani the 12th richest man in the world and Asia’s richest with personal wealth of $60.7 billion, narrowing the gap with Larry Ellison, founder and largest shareholder of Oracle, with personal wealth of $61.6 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index.
